Details

Getting Here

For those flying in, the Philadelphia Intl Airport (PHL) is the closest airport, which offers public transportation and private taxis into the city.


The wedding will be located in Northeast Philadelphia, approximately a 30 minute drive from the airport via I-95.

Where to Stay

We will arrange a room block for guests traveling from out of town. More details will be provided at a later date.

Please note - rooms are only available through our room block for the following nights:
Friday, April 18th
Saturday, April 19th

Getting Around

We'll be coordinating transportation from the hotel to Glen Foerd, but for when you want to get out and explore the city yourself, there are plenty of ways to get around.

Car

For out of town guests, a car will not be necessary to travel between the hotel and venue as transportation will be provided to and from the hotel to the venue. For guests who reside locally and guests who wish to rent a car, there will be valet parking available at Glen Foerd Mansion.

Uber & Lyft

Uber tends to be our app-of-choice, but Lyft also has good coverage as well.

iPhone Android

iPhone Android

Things to do in Philadelphia

To help you get oriented, all of the locations of interest are marked below.

Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell
Considered USA's birthplace, check out the famous historic sites in Philadelphia! For an educational day trip, I recommend visiting Independence Hall, a UNESCO World Heritage site, followed by the Liberty Bell which is nearby.

Philadelphia Art Museum (+ the 'Rocky Steps')
The cultural heart of Philadelphia and a must see if visiting. The museum is at the end of Benjamin Franklin Parkway and carries a vast collection of artwork. The exterior of the building is beautiful as well and you can usually point out the tourists who are running up the steps like they're Rocky (it's okay, go be cheesy for a day!). Don't forget to check out the Rocky statue as well!

Benjamin Franklin Parkway and its many Museums
Want to see more exhibitions? There are so many more museums to explore in Philadelphia, such as The Franklin Institute (every Philly kid knows of the giant heart), the Barnes Foundation, and the Academy of Natural Sciences. Aside from checking out museums, you simply can walk and admire the outside scenery. Philly is a really walkable city.

Reading Terminal Market
A very large and old historic food hall, the Reading Terminal Market offers dozens and dozens of diverse food vendors to get your grub on or take with you.

Avenue of the Arts
Located along Broad Street in between City Hall and South Street, the Avenue of the Arts features many of the city's performing art venues. Also, it's very Instagram-worthy to have your photo taken on the road divider with an awesome view of City Hall right behind.

Eat a Pretzel and get some Water Ice
Try another native Philly delicacy! Nothing better than a soft pretzel with some water ice to wash it down. Local chains are easy to find such as Philly Pretzel Factory + Rita's Water Ice. Be sure to check out the diverse and highly praised food/drink scene in Philly too! Admittedly, we aren't too familiar with the food scene to give recommendations!
